primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God tests Abraham's faith to reveal the nature of radical trust and ultimately provides a substitute, pointing to Christ.

subject.identificatie: God (as the primary mover and provider)
tekstueel_bewijs: God himself will provide the lamb
God was... working through Abraham’s faith to reveal a new thing

object.identificatie: The revelation of faith and the provision of salvation (the Lamb/Substitute)
tekstueel_bewijs: the salvation of the whole world
a ram, caught in a thicket... instead of his son
the same God whose promise Abraham has known

ontvanger.identificatie: Abraham, Isaac, and 'the whole world' (the Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: by you all the nations of the earth shall be blessed
He became the substitute for us

helper.identificatie: The Angel of the Lord / The Ram / The Holy Spirit (implied through faith)
tekstueel_bewijs: God himself will provide the lamb

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, the Abyss, and the 'Godforsakenness' of the test
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a moral failing but the total loss of the future and the reality of death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Abraham's response of faith to the divine mandate.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Abraham
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Abraham's action is a response to God's prior promise and mandate; it serves the primary program of revelation.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God himself will provide the lamb
God was... working through Abraham’s faith
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Abraham went and took the ram
We should see the story... in its context

voorbeelden: Abraham being told by God to sacrifice Isaac
the more I want to live by its promises
the person who has learned to live in the country of the Bible
God was able to do what he had promised
God was able to raise men even from the dead

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The focus is entirely on God's power to create out of nothing and raise the dead, rather than human obligation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (Promise) to S2 (The Command to Slay) to ~S1 (Darkness) and finally to ~S2 (The Ram/Christ as the negation of Death).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's own action (Substitution), not by Abraham's merit.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death and the loss of the future are treated as absolute threats.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the primary actor who provides what He demands. Even Abraham's faith is framed as a work of God's revelation.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: What Abraham did not have to do, God did... He became the substitute for us.
At the very moment that we avert our eyes... God acts.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Abraham is used as an example, but specifically as an example of 'radical trust' in a God who acts, rather than a model of moral behavior.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Abraham's faith is a window into God's character.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'providing the lamb' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The move from the Old Testament type to the New Testament fulfillment is seamless and structurally sound.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The ram was a substitute for Isaac... He became the substitute for us.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not explicitly named, but 'faith' functions as the gifted competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to 'godforsaken dark' and the 'abyss'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of the primary program (Salvation), and the human actor is the beneficiary of divine provision.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The emphasis on God's ability is the sermon's greatest strength.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids the trap of moralism by making the 'substitute' the climax of the narrative structure.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'strange country' metaphor; Greimas shows that this metaphor serves to destabilize the human Subject to make room for the Divine Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the text; Greimas shows how the text 'works' on the hearer by reassigning roles.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'substitute' is not just a theme but the structural resolution of the narrative's power axis.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace perfectly.
